Keywords: Armor , Brute , Latveria , Ruler
Real Name: Victor Von Doom
Special Powers
THE MANY FACES OF DOOM: At the beginning of the game, you may choose a starting line of equal points on a character from your sideline that also has this trait. If you do, replace this character with the chosen character.
COMPLETELY EXPECTED AND PLANNED FOR: When revealing forces, choose an opposing sideline game element. If Dr. Thing is on his starting click, the chosen sideline game element can't be brought into the game.
I'LL NEVER GIVE UP, YOU'LL NEVER WIN: Plasticity, Sidestep. FREE: Place Dr. Thing adjacent to an opposing character that attacked Dr. Thing since your last turn.
I BARELY FELT THAT: Invincible. Dr. Thing takes a maximum of 1 damage from range attacks.
Trade Dr. Thing Want Dr. Thing

Comments
March 1, 2021
realasnic
Finally pulled a chase in this set and it was him. I think he can be pretty good, most of them do need some form of outwit protection but if you can give it out he is pretty potent. I started by giving him the Scarface Object to give him minimum 4 range plus the RCE to pair with his CCE and so far so good. But in a more competitive arena I may have to just make him herald to gain him that 5 range and power cosmic. As a fan of Doom and The Ever Lovin' Blue Eyed Thing....I am a fan of this figure even if he is not considered the cream of the crop of these chases also do not under rate his ability to take a away sideline element. (BYE BLACK VULCAN)
February 16, 2021
Goop
Your "many faces" call in if your opponent is using some sideline element they are reliant on. I suppose he needs to be listed on your force since "revealing forces" comes before start of game. Anyway hes a solid bruiser attacker. High Dmg, cce, plasticity so they can't get away. His defense is great having all that invincible and limiting range dmg to 1. However its a power that can be outwitted unlike other pieces in the past that had similar abilities as a trait. Like all other Dooms he's better at his lower 75 line.
